definitions: A non-invasive method used to estimate body composition, particularly body fat and muscle mass, by measuring the opposition to the flow of a small electrical current through the body.
The measurement of the electrical impedance of biological tissue, which varies with water content and can be used to assess body composition.
examples: Bioelectrical Impedance is a common technique in fitness assessments.
The device uses Bioelectrical Impedance to calculate body fat percentage.
Research often utilizes Bioelectrical Impedance for body composition studies.
